classical.label: Classical
classical.description: The volume is measured by simply pouring it into a measuring container

displacement.label: Displacement
displacement.description: The volume is measured by having a known amount of water in a measuring container and then adding the object to be examined to measure the displaced volume

calculated.label: Calculated from expansion
calculated.description: The volume is calculated based on the relevant dimensions

Grabinschrift (Inschrift im Grabkontext).label: tomb inscription (inscription in the context of a grave)

horizontal.label: Horizontal
horizontal.description: Taken horizontally – e.g. surface or floor

grabSample.label: Grab sample
grabSample.description: Non-strategic, opportunistic sampling carried out without a predefined plan. It includes chance finds.

systematicSample.label: Systematic sample
systematicSample.description: Sampling strategy at regular intervals to evenly cover a defined space

judgementSample.label: Judgement sample
judgementSample.description: Selective sampling strategy based on prior knowledge, expert interpretation, or informed assumptions about the context being sampled

fixedVolume.label: Fixed volume
fixedVolume.description: Sampling strategy in which a consistent, predetermined volume of sediment is collected from each sampling unit to ensure uniformity

probabilistic.label: Probabilistic
probabilistic.description: Sampling strategy in which the probability that the sample reflects the population it comes from can be statistically assessed

random.label: Random
random.description: Sampling strategy in which samples are selected purely by chance, ensuring that every unit in the population has an equal probability of being chosen

eachQuadrant.label: Each quadrant
eachQuadrant.description: Sampling strategy where samples are collected from each defined quadrant within the site grid, ensuring systematic coverage of all areas

everyOtherQuadrant.label: Every other quadrant
everyOtherQuadrant.description: Sampling strategy where samples are collected in alternating quadrants within the site grid, following a checkerboard pattern to achieve systematic yet spaced coverage

100%.description: Sampling strategy in which the entire sediment within the defined unit is collected or analyzed

profile.label: Profile
profile.description: Sample taken from an exposed stratigraphic section during excavation

core.label: Core
core.description: Sample extracted using a coring device, typically without full excavation, to obtain a continuous vertical column of sediment

sondage.label: Sondage
sondage.description: A small test excavation or trench made to investigate the stratigraphy and recover discrete sediment samples from specific layers without aiming to understand the archaeological contexts that originated the deposits

monolith.label: Monolith
monolith.description: A continuous, undisturbed block of sediment extracted and kept in a fix container to preserve stratigraphy for micromorphological or laboratory analysis

recycledSystem.label: Recycled system
recycledSystem.description: Water that has been previously used and filtered for reuse within a closed or semi-closed system

riverPondWell.label: River, pond, or well
riverPondWell.description: Natural water taken from nearby rivers, ponds, wells, or similar sources

soaking.label: Soaking
soaking.description: The sample was immersed in water

soakingSoap.label: Soaking with soap
soakingSoap.description: The sample was immersed in a solution of water and mild detergent

soakingChemicals.label: Soaking with other chemicals
soakingChemicals.description: The sample was immersed in a water-and-chemical solution

sundryingSoaking.label: Sun-drying and soaking
sundryingSoaking.description: The sample was dried in the sunlight and then rehydrated

flotation.label: Flotation
flotation.description: A flotation tank (of 80 litres of capacity or more) with an outflow at the top is filled up with water and the sample is introduced into the tank, using a sieve or a net to prevent it to fall to the bottom of the tank. The sediment is left in the tank as long as organic material (charred) floats to the surface and it is gently stirred with the hands. A sieve, several sieves or a net is used to recover the light organic fraction that falls with the water coming out of the outflow. The remaining sediment in the tank is the heavy fraction.

flotationAirCompressor.label: Flotation with air compressor
flotationAirCompressor.description: Similar to flotation, this system uses compressed air to generate a whirlpool effect in the flotation machine to aid the disaggregation of the sediment lumps and the flotation of charred material

bucketFlotation.label: Bucket flotation
bucketFlotation.description: Sediment is poured into a bucket with water, hand-stirred and the supernatant is poured on a sieve or net. The process is repeated as many times as considered necessary until no more organic material floats.

washOver.label: Wash-over
washOver.description: Separation technique in which small amounts of sediment are gently swirled in a bowl with water. The suspended (supernatant) material is then poured over a stack of sieves to isolate lighter particles. The remaining heavy residue inside the bowl is kept as heavy fraction of the sample, while the suspended material becomes the light fraction.

waterScreening.label: Water-screening
waterScreening.description: Rapid sediment processing method where water is poured from a hose onto a stack of sieves

drySieving.label: Dry-sieving
drySieving.description: Processing technique in which dry soil is sifted through a series of nested sieves without the use of water

airDrying.label: Air-drying
airDrying.description: The sample was left to dry naturally, exposed to air

putIntoWater.label: Put into water
putIntoWater.description: The sample was kept in water

gridMethod.label: Grid method
gridMethod.description: Subsampling technique in which the sample is evenly spread out and divided into a marked grid. Subsamples are then taken from specific or randomly selected grid sections to ensure spatial representativeness and reduce sampling bias.

riffleBox.label: Riffle-box
riffleBox.description: Mechanical subsampling tool that divides a sample into equal, representative portions using alternating chutes

classical.label: Classical
classical.description: The sample volume is measured by simply pouring it into a measuring container

displacement.label: Displacement
displacement.description: The sample volume is measured by having a known amount of water in a measuring container and then adding the sample to measure the displaced volume
